1 (function($NS){
  2 	var utils = $NS.utils,
  3         isFunction = utils.isFunction,
  4         isObject = utils.isObject;
  5 	
  6 	/**
  7 	 * Listenable is used to emulate custom events and listeners
  8 	 * @class Listenable
  9 	 * @name py.Listenable
 10 	 * @constructor
 11 	 */
 12 	$NS.Class('Listenable', {
 13 		
 14 	    __registry: {},
 15 		
 16 		/**
 17 		 * Function adds a listener callback to the Listenable object,
 18 		 * to listen to the target custom event. This class should be used as 
 19 		 * a Mixin when creating object which can trigger custom events.
 20 		 * 
 21 		 * @function
 22 		 * @name py.Listenable#addListener
 23 		 * 
 24 		 * @example
 25 		 * 
 26 		 * py.Class('MyClass',{ Mixin: py.Listenable, 
 27 		 *    execute: function(){
 28 		 *        this.dispatchEvent('onExecuteCall');
 29 		 *    }
 30 		 * },'pckg');
 31 		 * 
 32 		 * var myInstance = new pckg.MyClass();
 33 		 * myInstance.addListener('onExecuteCall, function(){
 34 		 *    //handle custom event 
 35 		 * });
 36 		 * //...
 37 		 * myInstance.execute();
 38 		 * 
 39          * @param {String} eventName
 40          * @param {Function} callback
 41 		 */
 42 		addListener: function(eventName, callback){
 43 			var self = this,
 44 				registry = self.__registry;
 45 			
 46 			if(!utils.pairCall(self.addListener, arguments[0], self)){
 47 			    if(callback && (isFunction(callback) || isObject(callback))){
 48                     if(!registry[eventName]){
 49                         registry[eventName] = [];   
 50                     }
 51                     registry[eventName].push(callback);
 52                 }else{
 53                     throw "listener has to be a function or an object";
 54                 }
 55 			}
 56 		},
 57 		
 58 		/**
 59 		 * Function removes listening callback from target event
 60 		 * 
 61 		 * @function
 62 		 * @name py.Listenable#removeListener
 63 		 * 
 64          * @param {String} eventName
 65          * @param {Function} callback
 66 		 */
 67 		removeListener: function(eventName, callback){
 68 			var self = this,
 69 				registry = self.__registry[eventName],
 70 				i;
 71 				
 72 			if(registry){
 73 				i = registry.length;
 74 				while(i--){
 75 					if(registry[i] === callback){
 76 						registry.splice(i,1);
 77 						return;
 78 					}
 79 				}	
 80 			}
 81 		},
 82 		
 83 		/**
 84 		 * Function removes all listening callbacks
 85 		 * from target event
 86 		 * @function
 87 		 * @name py.Listenable#removeListeners
 88          * @param {String} eventName
 89 		 */
 90 		removeListeners: function(eventName){
 91 			var registry = this.__registry;
 92 			if(registry[eventName]){
 93 				delete registry[eventName];
 94 			}
 95 		},
 96 		
 97 		/**
 98 		 * Function notifies all listeners listening to 
 99 		 * the provided event. All parameters besides the 
100 		 * eventName are applied to every callback 
101 		 * 
102 		 * @function
103 		 * @name py.Listenable#dispatchEvent
104          * @param {String} eventName
105 		 */
106 		dispatchEvent: function(eventName){
107 			var self = this,
108 				args = Array.prototype.slice.call(arguments, 1),
109 				registry = self.__registry[eventName],
110 				listener,
111 				i,
112 				l;
113 			
114 			if(registry){
115 				for(i=0, l=registry.length; i<l; i++){
116 					listener = registry[i];
117 					if(isFunction(listener)){
118 						listener.apply(this, args);
119 					}else if(isFunction(listener[eventName])){
120 						listener[eventName].apply(listener, args);
121 					}
122 				}
123 			}
124 			
125 		}
126 	}, $NS);
127 	
128 }(patternity));
